reference.title: AArch64 system registers
reference.shortdesc: This chapter describes the system registers in the AArch64 state.

link.linktext: AArch64 registers
link.desc: This chapter provides information about the AArch64 system registers with implementation defined bit fields and implementation defined registers associated with the core.

link.linktext: Enyo/Deimos - AArch64 architectural system register summary
link.desc: This section describes the AArch64 architectural system registers implemented in the Cortex‑A76 core.

link.linktext: Enyo/Deimos - AArch64 implementation defined register summary
link.desc: This section describes the AArch64 registers in the Cortex‑A76 core that are implementation defined.

link.linktext: Enyo/Deimos - AArch64 registers by functional group
link.desc: This section identifies the AArch64 registers by their functional groups and applies to the registers in the core that are implementation defined or have micro-architectural bit fields. Reset values are provided for these registers.

link.linktext: ACTLR_EL1, Auxiliary Control Register, EL1
link.desc: ACTLR_EL1 provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED configuration and control options for execution at EL1 and EL0.

link.linktext: ACTLR_EL2, Auxiliary Control Register, EL2
link.desc: The ACTLR_EL2 provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED configuration and control options for EL2.

link.linktext: ACTLR_EL3, Auxiliary Control Register, EL3
link.desc: The ACTLR_EL3 provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED configuration and control options for EL3.

link.linktext: AFSR0_EL1, Auxiliary Fault Status Register 0, EL1
link.desc: AFSR0_EL1 provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED fault status information for exceptions that are taken to EL1. In the Cortex‑A76 core, no additional information is provided for these exceptions. Therefore this register is not used.

link.linktext: AFSR0_EL2, Auxiliary Fault Status Register 0, EL2
link.desc: AFSR0_EL2 provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED fault status information for exceptions that are taken to EL2.

link.linktext: AFSR0_EL3, Auxiliary Fault Status Register 0, EL3
link.desc: AFSR0_EL3 provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED fault status information for exceptions that are taken to EL3. In the Cortex‑A76 core, no additional information is provided for these exceptions. Therefore this register is not used.

link.linktext: AFSR1_EL1, Auxiliary Fault Status Register 1, EL1
link.desc: AFSR1_EL1 provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED fault status information for exceptions that are taken to EL1. This register is not used in Cortex‑A76.

link.linktext: AFSR1_EL2, Auxiliary Fault Status Register 1, EL2
link.desc: AFSR1_EL2 provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED fault status information for exceptions that are taken to EL2. This register is not used in the Cortex‑A76 core.

link.linktext: AFSR1_EL3, Auxiliary Fault Status Register 1, EL3
link.desc: AFSR1_EL3 provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED fault status information for exceptions that are taken to EL3. This register is not used in the Cortex‑A76 core.

link.linktext: AIDR_EL1, Auxiliary ID Register, EL1
link.desc: AIDR_EL1 provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED identification information. This register is not used in the Cortex‑A76 core.

link.linktext: AMAIR_EL1, Auxiliary Memory Attribute Indirection Register, EL1
link.desc: AMAIR_EL1 provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED memory attributes for the memory regions specified by MAIR_EL1. This register is not used in the Cortex‑A76 core.

link.linktext: AMAIR_EL2, Auxiliary Memory Attribute Indirection Register, EL2
link.desc: AMAIR_EL2 provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED memory attributes for the memory regions specified by MAIR_EL2. This register is not used in the Cortex‑A76 core.

link.linktext: AMAIR_EL3, Auxiliary Memory Attribute Indirection Register, EL3
link.desc: AMAIR_EL3 provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED memory attributes for the memory regions specified by MAIR_EL3. This register is not used in the Cortex‑A76 core.

link.linktext: CCSIDR_EL1, Cache Size ID Register, EL1
link.desc: The CCSIDR_EL1 provides information about the architecture of the currently selected cache.

link.linktext: CLIDR_EL1, Cache Level ID Register, EL1
link.desc: The CLIDR_EL1 identifies the type of cache, or caches, implemented at each level, up to a maximum of seven levels.

link.linktext: CPACR_EL1, Architectural Feature Access Control Register, EL1
link.desc: The CPACR_EL1 controls access to trace functionality and access to registers associated with Advanced SIMD and floating-point execution.

link.linktext: CPTR_EL2, Architectural Feature Trap Register, EL2
link.desc: The CPTR_EL2 controls trapping to EL2 for accesses to CPACR, trace functionality and registers associated with Advanced SIMD and floating-point execution. It also controls EL2 access to this functionality.

link.linktext: CPTR_EL3, Architectural Feature Trap Register, EL3
link.desc: The CPTR_EL3 controls trapping to EL3 of access to CPACR_EL1, CPTR_EL2, trace functionality and registers associated with Advanced SIMD and floating-point execution.

link.linktext: CPUACTLR_EL1, CPU Auxiliary Control Register, EL1
link.desc: The CPUACTLR_EL1 provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED configuration and control options for the core.

link.linktext: CPUACTLR2_EL1, CPU Auxiliary Control Register 2, EL1
link.desc: The CPUACTLR2_EL1 provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED configuration and control options for the core.

link.linktext: CPUACTLR3_EL1, CPU Auxiliary Control Register 3, EL1
link.desc: The CPUACTLR3_EL1 provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED configuration and control options for the core.

link.linktext: CPUCFR_EL1, CPU Configuration Register, EL1
link.desc: The CPUCFR_EL1 provides configuration information for the core.

link.linktext: CPUECTLR_EL1, CPU Extended Control Register, EL1
link.desc: The CPUECTLR_EL1 provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED configuration and control options for the core.

link.linktext: CPUPCR_EL3, CPU Private Control Register, EL3
link.desc: The CPUPCR_EL3 provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED configuration and control options for the core.

link.linktext: CPUPMR_EL3, CPU Private Mask Register, EL3
link.desc: The CPUPMR_EL3 provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED configuration and control options for the core.

link.linktext: CPUPOR_EL3, CPU Private Operation Register, EL3
link.desc: The CPUPOR_EL3 provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED configuration and control options for the core.

link.linktext: CPUPSELR_EL3, CPU Private Selection Register, EL3
link.desc: The CPUPSELR_EL3 provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED configuration and control options for the core.

link.linktext: CPUPWRCTLR_EL1, Power Control Register, EL1
link.desc: The CPUPWRCTLR_EL1 provides information about power control support for the core.

link.linktext: CSSELR_EL1, Cache Size Selection Register, EL1
link.desc: CSSELR_EL1 selects the current Cache Size ID Register (CCSIDR_EL1), by specifying:

link.linktext: CTR_EL0, Cache Type Register, EL0
link.desc: The CTR_EL0 provides information about the architecture of the caches.

link.linktext: DCZID_EL0, Data Cache Zero ID Register, EL0
link.desc: The DCZID_EL0 indicates the block size written with byte values of zero by the DC ZVA (Data Cache Zero by Address) system instruction.

link.linktext: DISR_EL1, Deferred Interrupt Status Register, EL1
link.desc: The DISR_EL1 records the SError interrupts consumed by an ESB instruction.

link.linktext: ERRIDR_EL1, Error ID Register, EL1
link.desc: The ERRIDR_EL1 defines the number of error record registers.

link.linktext: ERRSELR_EL1, Error Record Select Register, EL1
link.desc: The ERRSELR_EL1 selects which error record should be accessed through the Error Record system registers. This register is not reset on a warm reset.

link.linktext: ERXADDR_EL1, Selected Error Record Address Register, EL1
link.desc: Register ERXADDR_EL1 accesses the ERR<n>ADDR address register for the error record selected by ERRSELR_EL1.SEL.

link.linktext: ERXCTLR_EL1, Selected Error Record Control Register, EL1
link.desc: Register ERXCTLR_EL1 accesses the ERR<n>CTLR control register for the error record selected by ERRSELR_EL1.SEL.

link.linktext: ERXFR_EL1, Selected Error Record Feature Register, EL1
link.desc: Register ERXFR_EL1 accesses the ERR<n>FR feature register for the error record selected by ERRSELR_EL1.SEL.

link.linktext: ERXMISC0_EL1, Selected Error Record Miscellaneous Register 0, EL1
link.desc: Register ERXMISC0_EL1 accesses the ERR<n>MISC0 register for the error record selected by ERRSELR_EL1.SEL.

link.linktext: ERXMISC1_EL1, Selected Error Record Miscellaneous Register 1, EL1
link.desc: Register ERXMISC1_EL1 accesses the ERR<n>MISC1 miscellaneous register 1 for the error record selected by ERRSELR_EL1.SEL.

link.linktext: ERXPFGCDN_EL1, Selected Error Pseudo Fault Generation Count Down Register, EL1
link.desc: Register ERXPFGCDN_EL1 accesses the ERR<n>PFGCND register for the error record selected by ERRSELR_EL1.SEL.

link.linktext: ERXPFGCTL_EL1, Selected Error Pseudo Fault Generation Control Register, EL1
link.desc: Register ERXPFGCTL_EL1 accesses the ERR<n>PFGCTL register for the error record selected by ERRSELR_EL1.SEL.

link.linktext: ERXPFGF_EL1, Selected Pseudo Fault Generation Feature Register, EL1
link.desc: Register ERXPFGF_EL1 accesses the ERR<n>PFGF register for the error record selected by ERRSELR_EL1.SEL.

link.linktext: ERXSTATUS_EL1, Selected Error Record Primary Status Register, EL1
link.desc: Register ERXSTATUS_EL1 accesses the ERR<n>STATUS primary status register for the error record selected by ERRSELR_EL1.SEL.

link.linktext: ESR_EL1, Exception Syndrome Register, EL1
link.desc: The ESR_EL1 holds syndrome information for an exception taken to EL1.

link.linktext: ESR_EL2, Exception Syndrome Register, EL2
link.desc: The ESR_EL2 holds syndrome information for an exception taken to EL2.

link.linktext: ESR_EL3, Exception Syndrome Register, EL3
link.desc: The ESR_EL3 holds syndrome information for an exception taken to EL3.

link.linktext: HACR_EL2, Hyp Auxiliary Configuration Register, EL2
link.desc: HACR_EL2 controls trapping to EL2 of IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED aspects of Non-secure EL1 or EL0 operation. This register is not used in the Cortex‑A76 core.

link.linktext: HCR_EL2, Hypervisor Configuration Register, EL2
link.desc: The HCR_EL2 provides configuration control for virtualization, including whether various Non-secure operations are trapped to EL2.

link.linktext: ID_AA64AFR0_EL1, AArch64 Auxiliary Feature Register 0
link.desc: The core does not use this register, ID_AA64AFR0_EL1 is RES0.

link.linktext: ID_AA64AFR1_EL1, AArch64 Auxiliary Feature Register 1
link.desc: The core does not use this register, ID_AA64AFR0_EL1 is RES0.

link.linktext: ID_AA64DFR0_EL1, AArch64 Debug Feature Register 0, EL1
link.desc: Provides top-level information about the debug system in AArch64.

link.linktext: ID_AA64DFR1_EL1, AArch64 Debug Feature Register 1, EL1
link.desc: This register is reserved for future expansion of top level information about the debug system in AArch64 state.

link.linktext: ID_AA64ISAR0_EL1, AArch64 Instruction Set Attribute Register 0, EL1
link.desc: The ID_AA64ISAR0_EL1 provides information about the instructions implemented in AArch64 state, including the instructions that are provided by the Cryptographic Extension.

link.linktext: ID_AA64ISAR1_EL1, AArch64 Instruction Set Attribute Register 1, EL1
link.desc: The ID_AA64ISAR1_EL1 provides information about the instructions implemented in AArch64 state.

link.linktext: ID_AA64MMFR0_EL1, AArch64 Memory Model Feature Register 0, EL1
link.desc: The ID_AA64MMFR0_EL1 provides information about the implemented memory model and memory management support in the AArch64 Execution state.

link.linktext: ID_AA64MMFR1_EL1, AArch64 Memory Model Feature Register 1, EL1
link.desc: The ID_AA64MMFR1_EL1 provides information about the implemented memory model and memory management support in the AArch64 Execution state.

link.linktext: ID_AA64MMFR2_EL1, AArch64 Memory Model Feature Register 2, EL1
link.desc: The ID_AA64MMFR2_EL1 provides information about the implemented memory model and memory management support in the AArch64 Execution state.

link.linktext: ID_AA64PFR0_EL1, AArch64 Processor Feature Register 0, EL1
link.desc: The ID_AA64PFR0_EL1 provides additional information about implemented core features in AArch64.

link.linktext: ID_AA64PFR1_EL1, AArch64 Processor Feature Register 1, EL1
link.desc: The ID_AA64PFR1_EL1 provides additional information about implemented core features in AArch64.

link.linktext: ID_AFR0_EL1, AArch32 Auxiliary Feature Register 0, EL1
link.desc: The ID_AFR0_EL1 provides information about the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED features of the PE in AArch32. This register is not used in the Cortex‑A76 core.

link.linktext: ID_DFR0_EL1, AArch32 Debug Feature Register 0, EL1
link.desc: The ID_DFR0_EL1 provides top-level information about the debug system in AArch32.

link.linktext: ID_ISAR0_EL1, AArch32 Instruction Set Attribute Register 0, EL1
link.desc: The ID_ISAR0_EL1 provides information about the instruction sets implemented by the core in AArch32.

link.linktext: ID_ISAR1_EL1, AArch32 Instruction Set Attribute Register 1, EL1
link.desc: The ID_ISAR1_EL1 provides information about the instruction sets implemented by the core in AArch32.

link.linktext: ID_ISAR2_EL1, AArch32 Instruction Set Attribute Register 2, EL1
link.desc: The ID_ISAR2_EL1 provides information about the instruction sets implemented by the core in AArch32.

link.linktext: ID_ISAR3_EL1, AArch32 Instruction Set Attribute Register 3, EL1
link.desc: The ID_ISAR3_EL1 provides information about the instruction sets implemented by the core in AArch32.

link.linktext: ID_ISAR4_EL1, AArch32 Instruction Set Attribute Register 4, EL1
link.desc: The ID_ISAR4_EL1 provides information about the instruction sets implemented by the core in AArch32.

link.linktext: ID_ISAR5_EL1, AArch32 Instruction Set Attribute Register 5, EL1
link.desc: The ID_ISAR5_EL1 provides information about the instruction sets that the core implements.

link.linktext: ID_ISAR6_EL1, AArch32 Instruction Set Attribute Register 6, EL1
link.desc: The ID_ISAR6_EL1 provides information about the instruction sets that the core implements.

link.linktext: ID_MMFR0_EL1, AArch32 Memory Model Feature Register 0, EL1
link.desc: The ID_MMFR0_EL1 provides information about the memory model and memory management support in AArch32.

link.linktext: ID_MMFR1_EL1, AArch32 Memory Model Feature Register 1, EL1
link.desc: The ID_MMFR1_EL1 provides information about the memory model and memory management support in AArch32.

link.linktext: ID_MMFR2_EL1, AArch32 Memory Model Feature Register 2, EL1
link.desc: The ID_MMFR2_EL1 provides information about the implemented memory model and memory management support in AArch32.

link.linktext: ID_MMFR3_EL1, AArch32 Memory Model Feature Register 3, EL1
link.desc: The ID_MMFR3_EL1 provides information about the memory model and memory management support in AArch32.

link.linktext: ID_MMFR4_EL1, AArch32 Memory Model Feature Register 4, EL1
link.desc: The ID_MMFR4_EL1 provides information about the memory model and memory management support in AArch32.

link.linktext: ID_PFR0_EL1, AArch32 Processor Feature Register 0, EL1
link.desc: The ID_PFR0_EL1 provides top-level information about the instruction sets supported by the core in AArch32.

link.linktext: ID_PFR1_EL1, AArch32 Processor Feature Register 1, EL1
link.desc: The ID_PFR1_EL1 provides information about the programmers model and architecture extensions supported by the core.

link.linktext: ID_PFR2_EL1, AArch32 Processor Feature Register 2, EL1
link.desc: The ID_PFR2_EL1 provides information about the programmers model and architecture extensions supported by the core.

link.linktext: LORC_EL1, LORegion Control Register, EL1
link.desc: The LORC_EL1 register enables and disables LORegions, and selects the current LORegion descriptor.

link.linktext: LORID_EL1, LORegion ID Register, EL1
link.desc: The LORID_EL1 ID register indicates the supported number of LORegions and LORegion descriptors.

link.linktext: LORN_EL1, LORegion Number Register, EL1
link.desc: The LORN_EL1 register holds the number of the LORegion described in the current LORegion descriptor selected by LORC_EL1.DS.

link.linktext: MDCR_EL3, Monitor Debug Configuration Register, EL3
link.desc: The MDCR_EL3 provides configuration options for Security to self-hosted debug.

link.linktext: MIDR_EL1, Main ID Register, EL1
link.desc: The MIDR_EL1 provides identification information for the core, including an implementer code for the device and a device ID number.

link.linktext: MPIDR_EL1, Multiprocessor Affinity Register, EL1
link.desc: The MPIDR_EL1 provides an additional core identification mechanism for scheduling purposes in a cluster.

link.linktext: PAR_EL1, Physical Address Register, EL1
link.desc: The PAR_EL1 returns the output address from an address translation instruction that executed successfully, or fault information if the instruction did not execute successfully.

link.linktext: REVIDR_EL1, Revision ID Register, EL1
link.desc: The REVIDR_EL1 provides revision information, additional to MIDR_EL1, that identifies minor fixes (errata) which might be present in a specific implementation of the Cortex‑A76 core.

link.linktext: RMR_EL3, Reset Management Register
link.desc: The RMR_EL3 controls the execution state that the core boots into and allows request of a Warm reset.

link.linktext: RVBAR_EL3, Reset Vector Base Address Register, EL3
link.desc: RVBAR_EL3 contains the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED address that execution starts from after reset.

link.linktext: SCTLR_EL1, System Control Register, EL1
link.desc: The SCTLR_EL1 provides top-level control of the system, including its memory system, at EL1 and EL0.

link.linktext: SCTLR_EL2, System Control Register, EL2
link.desc: The SCTLR_EL2 provides top-level control of the system, including its memory system at EL2.

link.linktext: SCTLR_EL3, System Control Register, EL3
link.desc: The SCTLR_EL3 provides top-level control of the system, including its memory system at EL3.

link.linktext: TCR_EL1, Translation Control Register, EL1
link.desc: The TCR_EL1 determines which Translation Base registers define the base address register for a translation table walk required for stage 1 translation of a memory access from EL0 or EL1 and holds cacheability and shareability information.

link.linktext: TCR_EL2, Translation Control Register, EL2
link.desc: The TCR_EL2 controls translation table walks required for stage 1 translation of a memory access from EL2 and holds cacheability and shareability information.

link.linktext: TCR_EL3, Translation Control Register, EL3
link.desc: The TCR_EL3 controls translation table walks required for stage 1 translation of memory accesses from EL3 and holds cacheability and shareability information for the accesses.

link.linktext: TTBR0_EL1, Translation Table Base Register 0, EL1
link.desc: The TTBR0_EL1 holds the base address of translation table 0, and information about the memory it occupies. This is one of the translation tables for the stage 1 translation of memory accesses from modes other than Hyp mode.

link.linktext: TTBR0_EL2, Translation Table Base Register 0, EL2
link.desc: The TTBR0_EL2 holds the base address of the translation table for the stage 1 translation of memory accesses from EL2.

link.linktext: TTBR0_EL3, Translation Table Base Register 0, EL3
link.desc: The TTBR0_EL3 holds the base address of the translation table for the stage 1 translation of memory accesses from EL3.

link.linktext: TTBR1_EL1, Translation Table Base Register 1, EL1
link.desc: The TTBR1_EL1 holds the base address of translation table 1, and information about the memory it occupies. This is one of the translation tables for the stage 1 translation of memory accesses at EL0 and EL1.

link.linktext: TTBR1_EL2, Translation Table Base Register 1, EL2
link.desc: TTBR1_EL2 has the same format and contents as TTBR1_EL1.

link.linktext: VDISR_EL2, Virtual Deferred Interrupt Status Register, EL2
link.desc: The VDISR_EL2 records that a virtual SError interrupt has been consumed by an ESB instruction executed at Non-secure EL1.

link.linktext: VSESR_EL2, Virtual SError Exception Syndrome Register (Ares Specific)
link.desc: The VSESR_EL2 provides the syndrome value reported to software on taking a virtual SError interrupt exception.

link.linktext: VTCR_EL2, Virtualization Translation Control Register, EL2
link.desc: The VTCR_EL2 controls the translation table walks required for the stage 2 translation of memory accesses from Non-secure EL0 and EL1.

link.linktext: VTTBR_EL2, Virtualization Translation Table Base Register, EL2
link.desc: VTTBR_EL2 holds the base address of the translation table for the stage 2 translation of memory accesses from Non-secure EL0 and EL1.
